Package com.github.tommyettinger.cringe

Class PointSequence<V extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<V>>

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.cringe.PointSequence<V>
Type Parameters:
V - the libGDX Vector type of points, such as Vector2 or Vector3
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.Serializable, Externalizable, Serializable, Iterable<V>, Iterator<V>
Direct Known Subclasses:
PointSequence.Halton2, PointSequence.Halton3, PointSequence.Halton4, PointSequence.Halton5, PointSequence.Halton6, PointSequence.R2, PointSequence.R3, PointSequence.R4, PointSequence.R5, PointSequence.R6
public abstract class PointSequence<V extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<V>> extends Object implements Iterator<V>, Iterable<V>, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.Serializable, Externalizable
A parent type for infinite point sequences, such as Halton sequences and the R2 sequence. This has several inner classes that extend PointSequence, currently all "low-discrepancy sequences." PointSequence.R2 will look more random for the first several elements than the similar PointSequence.Halton2 sequence, and R2 will maintain a higher minimum distance between points than Halton will. R2 will start to look more patterned than Halton after enough points have been produced to see repeating line patterns in R2 that aren't present in Halton sequences.
All PointSequence subclasses can be serialized using libGDX Json or with anything compatible with Externalizable, such as Apache Fory. They can be iterated over like any Iterable, or they can be treated as an Iterator; both return V items.
See Also:

    PointSequence.Halton2
    A very simple Iterator or Iterable over Vector2 items, this produces Vector2 points that won't overlap or be especially close to each other for a long time by using a 2D Halton Sequence.

    • vanDerCorput

      public static float vanDerCorput(int base, int index)
      Gets the index-th element from the base-base van der Corput sequence. The base should usually be a prime number. The index must be greater than 0 and should be less than 16777216. The number this returns is a float between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (exclusive).
      Parameters:
      base - a (typically) prime number to use as the base/radix of the van der Corput sequence
      index - the position in the sequence of the requested base, as a positive int
      Returns:
      a quasi-random float between 0.0 (inclusive) and 1.0 (exclusive).
